item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, November 20, 2024 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. FireDucks: Pandas but 100x Faster (101 points | 29 comments)
2. Understanding the BM25 full text search algorithm (138 points | 14 comments)
3. Discarded delights: The joy of ex-library books (15 points | 12 comments)
4. 1-Bit AI Infrastructure (68 points | 12 comments)
5. Clearest Health (YC S23) is hiring a full-stack engineer in NY ( | hide)
6. Show HN: Retry a command with exponential backoff and jitter (+ Starlark exprs) (6 points | 1 comment)

8. Open Riak – open, modern Riak fork (170 points | 63 comments)

10. Show HN: Physically accurate black hole simulation using your iPhone camera (275 points | 107 comments)
11. Query Your Python Lists (43 points | 14 comments)
12. Launch HN: Regatta Storage (YC F24) – Turn S3 into a local-like, POSIX cloud FS (567 points | 308 comments)

14. Bottles of OOP now available in Python (164 points | 41 comments)
15. Recycled Server Components Bring More Sustainability (27 points | 14 comments)

18. Nominal for Storing, Structural for Manipulating (25 points | 15 comments)

20. Meta Uses LLMs to Improve Incident Response (121 points | 13 comments)
21. Chemist Identifies Mystery 'Blobs' Washing Up in Newfoundland (44 points | 19 comments)
22. Fair coins tend to land on the side they started (366 points | 174 comments)
23. Shift Left Is the Tip of the Iceberg (149 points | 80 comments)
24. The Analog Thing: Analog Computing for the Future (97 points | 25 comments)
25. PaCMAP: Large-Scale Dimension Reduction with Both Global and Local Structure [pdf] (27 points | 4 comments)
26. A joke in approximating numbers raised to irrational powers (92 points | 35 comments)
27. Show HN: Rust library for numerical integration of real-valued functions (115 points | 41 comments)
28. Nickel Plating Handbook [pdf] (32 points | 8 comments)
29. Prusa CORE One: Our new fully-enclosed CoreXY 3D printer (35 points | 8 comments)
